unnormalised: **Fuel Efficiency Gains Traction in Automotive Market**
normalised: **Fuel Efficiency Gains Traction in Automotive Market**

unnormalised: Hey petrolheads! Feeling the pinch at the pump these days? Looks like carmakers are finally listening. Fuel efficiency is becoming the "it" thing, especially with petrol prices higher than the Himalayas.
normalised: Hey petrolheads! Feeling the pinch at the pump these days? Looks like carmakers are finally listening. Fuel efficiency is becoming the "it" thing, especially with petrol prices higher than the Himalayas.

unnormalised: Rumor has it, Maruti Suzuki is prepping a new engine boasting over 25 km/l! That’s almost biryani-level satisfaction per liter, right?
normalised: Rumor has it, Maruti Suzuki is prepping a new engine boasting over twenty five kilometer per liter! That’s almost biryani-level satisfaction per liter, right?

unnormalised: Even Tata Motors is jumping on the bandwagon with their updated Nexon, supposedly hitting mileage figures that’ll make your wallet sing during Diwali shopping trips.
normalised: Even Tata Motors is jumping on the bandwagon with their updated Nexon, supposedly hitting mileage figures that’ll make your wallet sing during Diwali shopping trips.

unnormalised: Sources say ARAI testing is getting stricter, pushing manufacturers to innovate.
normalised: Sources say A R A I testing is getting stricter, pushing manufacturers to innovate.

unnormalised: And Mahindra? Whispers of a hybrid Scorpio are floating around, maybe just in time for Onam festivities.
normalised: And Mahindra? Whispers of a hybrid Scorpio are floating around, maybe just in time for Onam festivities.

unnormalised: Experts from IIT Madras are also chipping in, researching alternative fuels and engine designs to boost efficiency even further.
normalised: Experts from I I T Madras are also chipping in, researching alternative fuels and engine designs to boost efficiency even further.

unnormalised: Seems like the days of guzzling petrol like it’s chai are numbered. Now if only they could make them cheaper…Rs. 75/liter would be nice!
normalised: Seems like the days of guzzling petrol like it’s chai are numbered. Now if only they could make them cheaper…rupees seventy five per liter would be nice!
